Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 71.43% similar toCrotalicidin[15-34]K: 50%, F: 21%, V: 14%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or KPC+001812446 (MIC 2 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 or KPC+001812446 (MIC 2-16 ug/ml), and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 64 ug/ml).AMP inactivation: like the pro-form of cathelicidin, the attachment of a 10-glutamic propeptide (i.e., E10-Ctn[15-34], led to full inactivation of Ctn[15-34] (Junior et al., 2018).
Literature Information.Author: Júnior NGO, Cardoso MH, Cândido ES, van den Broek D, de Lange N, Velikova N, Kleijn JM, Wells JM, Rezende TMB, Franco OL, de Vries R. 2018
Literature Information.Title: An acidic model pro-peptide affects the secondary structure, membrane interactions and antimicrobial activity of a crotalicidin fragment.
